ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.2_0: At that time the Buddha spoke in many ways about the Monastic Law in the Monastic Law, on the Monastic Law, and on the Monastic Law in the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.5_0: “Well then, let’s learn the Monastic Law from Venerable Upāli.” And many monks, both senior and junior, as well as those of middle standing, learned the Monastic Law from Upāli.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.8_0: “If these monks become well-versed in the Monastic Law, they’ll boss us around as they like.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.9_0: So let’s disparage the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.10_0: They then went to the monks from the group of six and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.11_0: “What’s the point of reciting these minor and insignificant training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.12_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.13_0: “How can the monks from the group of six disparage the Monastic Law?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.14_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.17_0: “... Foolish men, how can you disparage the Monastic Law?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.18_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.19_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.20.1_0: ‘When the Monastic Code is being recited, if a monk says, “What’s the point of reciting these minor and insignificant training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?” then in disparaging the training rules, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.5_0: When the Monastic Code is being recited:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.6_0: when reciting it, when having it recited, or when practicing it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.8_0: “What’s the point of reciting these minor and insignificant training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.9_0: If they’re anxious, they don’t become anxious, and don’t feel oppressed.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.9_1: “This isn’t recited, this is your tradition; this is the texts on monastic training, this is the Monastic Law, and this is the Teacher’s instruction.” “They will disappear,” “They’ve disappeared.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.1_0: If he disparages the Monastic Law to one who is fully ordained, and he perceives them as such, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.2_0: If he disparages the Monastic Law to one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.3_0: If he disparages the Monastic Law to one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive them as fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.4_0: If he disparages some other rule, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.5_0: If he disparages the Monastic Law or some other rule to one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.6_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.7_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.8_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.3.2_0: if, not desiring to disparage, he says, “Listen, learn discourses or verses or philosophy, and later you can learn the Monastic Law;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.3.4_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.3.5_0: The second rule, the training rule on scratching, is finished.
